components.name: RatioMatching
components.description: A drag-and-drop exercise component for Unit 3 (Three-Statement Storyboard) that teaches students to match financial ratios to their corresponding formulas. Students learn 8 essential financial ratios across 4 categories: Liquidity (Current Ratio, Quick Ratio), Profitability (Return on Assets, Gross Profit Margin), Efficiency (Inventory Turnover, Accounts Receivable Turnover), and Leverage (Debt-to-Equity, Times Interest Earned). Features real-world business context, hint system with investor perspectives, color-coded categories, immediate feedback, and score tracking. Supports the Unit 3 learning objective of interpreting key financial ratios for investor analysis and three-statement integration.

components.name: BudgetCategorySort
components.description: A drag-and-drop exercise component for Unit 4 (Data-Driven Café) that teaches students to organize café operating expenses into budget categories. Students learn to categorize 15 café expenses across 5 budget categories: Cost of Goods Sold (COGS), Labor Costs, Overhead (Fixed Costs), Marketing & Customer Acquisition, and Administrative Expenses. Features real-world café context, monthly budget totals, profit impact indicators, hint system with business insights, immediate feedback with color-coded results, and score tracking. Supports Unit 4's learning objectives of statistical analysis and data-driven operations optimization by connecting expense categorization to POS data analysis and profit maximization goals.

components.name: RatioMatching
components.description: Interactive drag-and-drop exercise for matching financial ratios to their formulas. Covers 8 essential ratios across 4 categories (Liquidity, Profitability, Efficiency, Leverage). Features hint system, real-world business context, progress tracking, and immediate feedback. Supports Unit 3's Three-Statement Storyboard learning objectives for financial statement analysis and investor storytelling.

components.name: BudgetCategorySort
components.description: Interactive drag-and-drop exercise for organizing café operating expenses into budget categories (COGS, Labor, Overhead, Marketing, Administrative). Features 15 real café expenses with amounts, business context, profit impact analysis, and immediate feedback. Supports Unit 4's Data-Driven Café theme by connecting expense categorization to POS data analysis and waste reduction optimization.

components.name: PercentageCalculationSorting
components.description: Interactive drag-and-drop exercise where students categorize 18 café business scenarios by percentage calculation type (Percentage Change, Percentage of Total, Percentage Increase/Decrease, Weighted Average). Supports Unit 4 Data-Driven Café by building mathematical foundations for POS data analysis and statistical reporting. Features real-world café scenarios, hint system with formulas, immediate feedback with scoring, and connects to Excel Analysis ToolPak usage.

components.name: InterestCalculationBuilder
components.description: Interactive calculator for different types of interest calculations focused on PayDay Simulator cash flow scenarios. Students learn simple interest, compound interest, annuity payments, and present value calculations through 6 realistic business scenarios including payroll bridge loans, equipment financing, invoice factoring, emergency fund planning, credit line interest, and lease vs buy analysis. Features Excel formula integration, SafeFormulaEvaluator security, step-by-step calculation building, business interpretation, and calculation history tracking.

components.name: BreakEvenAnalysisCalculator
components.description: Advanced break-even analysis calculator with Goal Seek, Data Tables, and Sensitivity Analysis for Unit 6 PriceLab Challenge. Features comprehensive CVP modeling including margin of safety analysis, operating leverage calculations, one- and two-variable data tables for what-if scenarios, and professional Excel export functionality. Includes detailed 'How to Play' instructions with business context and strategic recommendations for pricing decisions.

components.name: InventoryFlowDiagram
components.description: Interactive drag-and-drop exercise teaching FIFO (First-In, First-Out) and LIFO (Last-In, First-Out) inventory cost flow visualization for Unit 7 Asset & Inventory Tracker. Students arrange randomized inventory lots in correct order to understand cost flow assumptions and their impact on Cost of Goods Sold and ending inventory values. Features 3 realistic business scenarios (TechZone Laptops, Roasted Bean Café, AutoPro Parts), editable sales transactions with quantity inputs, real-time cost calculations, method comparison, and connects inventory valuation methods to business strategy and financial reporting. Enhanced with randomization of inventory lot order and interactive sales transaction management.

components.name: DepreciationMethodBuilder
components.description: Interactive depreciation calculator for different asset depreciation methods focused on Unit 7 Asset & Inventory Tracker. Features 4 realistic asset scenarios (Commercial Oven, Delivery Truck, POS System, Manufacturing Equipment) with comprehensive educational content including method names, descriptions, and rationales. Supports Straight-Line, Double Declining Balance, Sum-of-Years-Digits, and Units of Production methods with year-by-year depreciation schedules, industry-standard Excel function integration (SLN, DDB, SYD), and business strategy advice for tax optimization.

components.name: DepreciationMethodBuilder
components.description: Comprehensive depreciation calculation component for Unit 7 Asset & Inventory Tracker. Features 4 depreciation methods (Straight-line, Double Declining Balance, Sum-of-Years-Digits, Units of Production) with 4 realistic business scenarios. Includes interactive calculations, tax strategy analysis, Excel formula integration, and educational guidance for professional depreciation method selection.

components.name: TAccountsVisualization
components.description: Visual representation of multiple T-accounts demonstrating the fundamental accounting equation (Assets = Liabilities + Equity). Features interactive account selection, real-time equation balance verification, color-coded account types, and comprehensive educational displays for Unit 1 Smart Ledger Launch.

components.name: TransactionJournal
components.description: Interactive transaction journal for managing startup transactions and building a self-auditing ledger system. Allows students to record, track, and validate business transactions for their chosen client focus in Unit 1 (Smart Ledger Launch). Features include client type selection, real-time balance validation, transaction analytics, and educational best practices guidance. Supports multiple transaction entries with automatic balance checking and provides visual feedback for learning double-entry bookkeeping principles.
components.usageExample: <TransactionJournal title="Startup Transaction Journal" clientTypes={["Tech Startup", "E-commerce Business"]} maxTransactions={10} showAnalytics={true} />

components.name: PeerCritiqueForm
components.description: Structured peer feedback form for project presentations, Excel models, and business analysis work. Features comprehensive evaluation categories (Strengths, Improvements, Excel Skills, Business Insight, Presentation), 5-star rating system, progress tracking, and professional communication guidelines. Develops critical evaluation skills, business communication, and supports collaborative learning environment in PBL methodology. Used across multiple units for authentic peer assessment aligned with industry practices.

components.name: ErrorCheckingSystem
components.description: Interactive component that teaches students to build conditional formatting rules for business data validation. Students learn to create automated error checking systems using Excel conditional formatting and formulas. Features three business validation scenarios (Payroll, Inventory, Financial) with different validation types (range, logic, format, completeness). Students can test validation rules against sample data and see how errors are highlighted using conditional formatting colors. Essential for Unit 2's Month-End Wizard where automated error checking reduces closing time from days to hours.

components.name: PitchPresentationBuilder
components.description: Interactive 4-minute investor pitch preparation tool for Unit 8 capstone business model presentations. Students build professional pitch decks with 6 essential sections (Problem, Solution, Market, Business Model, Financials, Ask), practice with built-in timer, and export presentation-ready materials. Features business model selection, content completeness tracking, speaking notes, presentation timeline guidance, and authentic investor pitch structure. Supports real-world entrepreneurship skills, storytelling, financial projections, and authentic audience engagement for startup funding scenarios.

components.name: FeedbackCollector
components.description: Expert stakeholder feedback collection form for professional industry mentorship. Facilitates structured feedback from investors, CPAs, entrepreneurs, consultants, and bankers on student business models, financial projections, and presentations. Features professional 5-level rating system (Needs Work → Expert Level), 6 evaluation categories (Financial Accuracy, Business Viability, Presentation Quality, Industry Knowledge, Innovation Potential, Implementation Readiness), stakeholder-specific focus areas, mentorship opportunities, and career guidance collection. Supports authentic audience engagement and real-world validation of academic work in the PBL methodology.

Each framework includes performance tasks, progressive milestones, standardized rubrics, student choices, and comprehensive resources.

units.rationale: Early-stage startup bookkeeping is often chaotic and unsustainable, creating significant business risk. This unit is designed to teach founders the importance of building a trustworthy, organized financial system ('clean books') from day one. This isn't just for investors or accountants; it's a critical tool for founders to gain clarity on their financial health, make decisions based on facts, and build confidence in their venture.
units.title: Unit 1: Smart Ledger Launch
units.description: Your team represents a startup seeking angel investment. Investors will scrutinize your financial controls before writing a check. You must build a self-auditing ledger system that demonstrates you can maintain "clean books" from day one. The primary deliverable is a 4-minute investor pitch and a live Excel workbook demo showing self-auditing features.

units.rationale: Students will experience the real cost of slow month-end closes and learn to build automated solutions that maintain accounting accuracy while dramatically improving efficiency.
units.description: What automation can cut our month-end closing time from two days to two hours without sacrificing GAAP accuracy?
units.title: Month-End Wizard

units.rationale: Students will dissect real company financial statements and map narrative threads to specific line items, creating a comprehensive financial story for investors.
units.title: Three-Statement Storyboard
units.description: How do today's journal entries flow into a narrative of profit, solvency, and cash health that investors can trust?
Given two years of POS data, what inventory and staffing plan will maximize weekend profits without raising waste above 3%?
units.rationale: Work with real café POS data to create data-driven recommendations for weekend operations optimization.
units.title: Data-Driven Café

units.rationale: Small business owners often struggle with cash flow timing, especially when payroll obligations coincide with other major expenses like rent. Through this unit, you'll build a comprehensive payroll system that helps predict and manage these cash flow challenges.
units.title: PayDay Simulator
units.description: How can a small business owner predict payroll cash-outs and still make rent on time?

units.rationale: Using live competitor price data and advanced Excel tools, teams will develop data-driven pricing recommendations through CVP analysis and sensitivity modeling.
units.description: What pricing strategy hits our profit target while staying competitive in the local market?
units.title: PriceLab Challenge

units.description: Which depreciation and inventory methods best align with our cash‑flow and tax strategy?
units.title: Asset & Inventory Tracker
units.rationale: Local auditor shares a real case of a company fined for inventory misvaluation and provides anonymized asset and inventory data.

units.description: Can we convince a micro‑VC that our first‑year financial model is robust enough to merit funding?
units.title: Year‑1 Startup Model
units.rationale: A venture capitalist guest outlines common red flags in rookie startup models and challenges students to avoid them. Students review anonymized pitch decks and model failures.

appConnections.usageDescription: Interactive exercise to help students learn and practice identifying key financial ratios before selecting 3-4 KPIs for their business dashboard. Students drag and match financial ratios to their formulas, learning the business meaning and importance of each ratio category (Liquidity, Profitability, Efficiency, Leverage).

Interactive exercise to help students understand café expense categorization before analyzing POS data. Students learn to organize operating expenses into budget categories (COGS, Labor, Overhead, Marketing, Administrative), providing foundation for cost-benefit analysis and inventory/staffing optimization decisions.

Students practice identifying different types of percentage calculations used in business data analysis before learning statistical methods for outlier identification. This component builds mathematical foundations needed for understanding descriptive statistics and z-score calculations in the café POS data context.

Students use the InterestCalculationBuilder to explore different financing options for payroll cash flow challenges. Teams analyze various scenarios including bridge loans, invoice factoring, and equipment financing to understand the true costs of different solutions for payroll timing problems. This builds mathematical foundations for interest calculations while connecting to real business cash flow management decisions.

Students use the advanced break-even calculator during guided practice to learn CVP model construction with Goal Seek and Data Tables. Instructor demonstrates how to build comprehensive break-even models using the tabbed interface, showing Goal Seek for target profit scenarios and creating one-variable data tables for sensitivity analysis. This provides hands-on experience with advanced Excel techniques that students will use in their pricing strategy development.

During independent practice, students work individually with the BreakEvenAnalysisCalculator to build visual CVP relationships for their chosen business scenarios. They experiment with the Data Tables tab to create two-variable sensitivity matrices, analyze margin of safety calculations, and use the Analysis tab to generate strategic pricing recommendations. Students export their work to Excel format for later use in pricing strategy presentations.

For assessment, students demonstrate CVP model mastery by using the BreakEvenAnalysisCalculator to solve complex pricing scenarios with multiple constraints. They must show proficiency with Goal Seek functionality, create comprehensive data tables showing sensitivity to key variables, and provide business interpretation of margin of safety and operating leverage results. Assessment focuses on both technical Excel skills and business analysis insights.

Interactive drag-and-drop exercise for students to practice arranging inventory lots in FIFO and LIFO order. Students work with realistic business scenarios (TechZone Laptops, Roasted Bean Café, AutoPro Parts) to visualize cost flow assumptions and understand the financial impact of inventory method selection on COGS and ending inventory values. Component provides real-time calculations and method comparison to reinforce Unit 7 inventory valuation concepts.

Interactive depreciation calculator component for hands-on practice with different depreciation methods. Students work through 4 realistic asset scenarios (Commercial Oven, Delivery Truck, POS System, Manufacturing Equipment) to understand Straight-Line, Double Declining Balance, Sum-of-Years-Digits, and Units of Production depreciation calculations. Includes Excel formula integration and business strategy advice for tax optimization decision-making.

Interactive visualization demonstrating the fundamental accounting equation (Assets = Liabilities + Equity) through multiple T-accounts. Students can explore account relationships, see real-time balance calculations, and understand how transactions affect the accounting equation balance.

Students use the TransactionJournal component to independently practice recording and validating business transactions for their chosen startup type. The component provides real-time feedback on balance validation and includes analytics to track accuracy rates, supporting the development of clean books for investor confidence.

Students use the PeerCritiqueForm component to provide structured feedback on peer presentations and Excel models. This supports collaborative learning and critical evaluation skills development through professional peer review practices.

Debug page featuring the PeerCritiqueForm component with multiple test scenarios (Unit 1 Smart Ledger, Unit 3 Three-Statement Model, Unit 8 Year-1 Startup Model) for development testing and teacher preview.

Interactive component where students learn to build conditional formatting rules for business data validation. Students select from three business scenarios (Payroll, Inventory, Financial) and test validation rules against sample data to see how errors are highlighted. Supports Unit 1's Smart Ledger Launch by teaching automated error detection that builds stakeholder trust through systematic validation.

Interactive 4-minute investor pitch builder with content structure, practice timer, and presentation mode. Students use this component to develop compelling pitch presentations for their Smart Ledger solutions, practicing the storytelling elements needed for authentic investor audiences. Includes business model selection, section-by-section content development, speaking notes, and presentation rehearsal features essential for the Unit 1 capstone investor showcase.

Expert stakeholder feedback collection for Unit presentations and final projects. Supports investors, CPAs, entrepreneurs, consultants, and bankers providing professional feedback on student business models, financial projections, and presentation quality. Used during Assessment phases to gather authentic audience evaluation.

Professional mentorship and career guidance collection from industry experts during lesson closing activities. Enables ongoing stakeholder engagement and provides students with real-world business perspectives and networking opportunities for continued learning.

tasks.description:
COMPONENT REBUILD REQUIRED: Create comprehensive depreciation calculation component for Unit 7 Asset & Inventory Tracker.

EDUCATIONAL OBJECTIVES:
- Master 4 depreciation methods: Straight-line, Double Declining Balance, Sum-of-Years-Digits, Units of Production
- Understand tax strategy implications of depreciation method selection
- Build Excel proficiency with depreciation functions (SLN, DDB, SYD)
- Connect asset management to business cash flow and financial statements

LAYOUT SPECIFICATIONS:
- Header: Title with instructions/formula toggles
- 4 Asset scenario tabs: Commercial Oven, Delivery Truck, POS System, Manufacturing Equipment
- Two-column responsive layout:
  LEFT: Business context, method explanation, input fields, action buttons
  RIGHT: Depreciation schedule table, business advice, Excel formulas
- Educational footer connecting to Unit 7 objectives

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:
- React component with scenario state management
- 4 calculation algorithms with error handling
- Responsive Tailwind CSS grid layout
- shadcn/ui components for consistency
- SafeFormulaEvaluator integration for security
- Year-by-year depreciation schedule display
- Excel formula generation for each method

BUSINESS SCENARIOS:
1. Commercial Oven ($15K, 10yr) - Straight-line for consistent expenses
2. Delivery Truck ($35K, 8yr) - Double declining for tax benefits  
3. POS System ($8K, 5yr) - Sum-of-years for technology assets
4. Manufacturing Equipment ($50K, 100K units) - Units of production

Each scenario includes realistic business context, default values, method rationale, and Excel implementation guidance.

tasks.title: Phase 1: Summative Assessment Design - Unit Project Framework
tasks.description: Create authentic capstone projects for all 8 units with detailed rubrics, milestone checkpoints, and self-contained assessment criteria. Extract summative assessment patterns from existing unit01-lesson-plan.ts (investor pitches, business models, etc.) and adapt for all units. Each unit project should be completable with classroom resources only.

tasks.title: Phase 2: Backwards Design Lesson Mapping
tasks.description: Map existing 10-day teacher lesson structure from unit01-lesson-plan.ts to 10-lesson MCP database structure. Each lesson needs specific learning objectives that scaffold toward unit summative projects. Create formative assessments (exit tickets, practice problems, peer critiques) for each lesson that build systematically toward final project mastery.

tasks.title: Phase 3: Teacher Section 10-Lesson Restructure
tasks.description: Restructure teacher routing from /unit-lesson-plans/unit01/ to /teacher/unit01/lesson-01/ format. Create teacher-facing lesson plan pages for all 10 lessons per unit with phase-specific content: objectives, hook activities, introduction content, guided-practice instructions, assessment criteria, differentiation strategies, and teacher notes. Pull detailed content from existing teacher data files.

tasks.title: Phase 4: ELL Student-Facing Content Creation
tasks.description: Design student lesson pages with 8th grade reading level for ELL support. Create simplified vocabulary glossaries with business terms, visual infographics for complex concepts, step-by-step instructions with screenshots for Excel tasks, and sentence frames for business writing. Include complete lesson content accessible online with self-paced learning features for absent students (common in Grade 12 due to university prep).

tasks.title: Phase 1 Complete: Summative Assessment Framework Documentation
tasks.description: PHASE 1 COMPLETE: Successfully created comprehensive summative assessment design framework for all 8 units. Extracted patterns from unit01-lesson-plan.ts and developed standardized UnitProjectFramework system with authentic performance tasks, progressive milestones, weighted rubrics, and self-contained classroom resources. All frameworks feature professional audience engagement (investors, Innovation Fair, executives, etc.) and support project-based learning methodology. Framework includes validation utilities and resource management tools. ✅ CREATED ALL 8 SUMMATIVE ASSESSMENTS in curriculum-mcp system with detailed evaluation criteria and authentic presentation scenarios.

tasks.title: Audit and Fix Lesson Learning Objectives
tasks.description: Review all 10 lessons and update learning objectives to be lesson-specific, measurable, and scaffolded toward the unit summative assessment (investor pitch). Current objectives are too generic and repeated across lessons.

tasks.title: Restructure Lesson Phases for PBL 6-Phase Model
tasks.description: Ensure each lesson follows the proper 6-phase structure: Hook, Introduction, Guided Practice, Independent Practice, Assessment, Closing. Many lessons are missing phases or have incorrect sequencing. Focus on authentic PBL activities rather than direct instruction.

tasks.title: Create Lesson-Specific Formative Assessments
tasks.description: Design formative assessments for each lesson that check mastery of specific lesson objectives. Include exit tickets, practice problems, peer critiques, and digital checkpoints. Assessments should predict student success on summative assessment.

tasks.title: Update Key Concepts for Progressive Skill Building
tasks.description: Revise key concepts for each lesson to be lesson-specific and build systematically across the unit. Current concepts are duplicated across lessons. Each lesson should introduce new concepts that scaffold toward final project mastery.

tasks.title: Enhance Pedagogical Approaches for Authentic PBL
tasks.description: Revise pedagogical approaches to move beyond direct instruction toward authentic PBL practices. Include inquiry-based learning, collaborative problem-solving, student choice, and real-world application. Align with Sarah's TechStart scenario throughout.

tasks.title: Validate Duration Estimates for PBL Activities
tasks.description: Review and adjust duration estimates for each lesson based on PBL activities, collaborative work, and realistic classroom implementation. Consider time for inquiry, discussion, hands-on practice, and reflection.

tasks.title: Enhanced Teacher Navigation with Lesson Selector Dropdown
tasks.description: Successfully implemented lesson selector dropdown in TeacherLessonPlan component, allowing teachers to jump directly to any lesson (1-10) within a unit for efficient class preparation. Added dual navigation system with both dropdown for big jumps and arrow buttons for adjacent lesson navigation. Tested and verified functionality across multiple lessons in Unit 1.

tasks.title: Phase 3 Enhancement: Teacher UX Improvements
tasks.description: Enhanced Phase 3 teacher section with improved navigation UX based on user feedback. Replaced linear previous/next navigation with practical lesson selector dropdown allowing direct jumping to specific lessons. Maintains teacher-focused design with lesson titles, timing information, and dual navigation options for optimal classroom preparation workflow.

tasks.title: Create VocabularyGlossary component with business terms
tasks.description: Build a vocabulary glossary component that displays business terms at 8th grade reading level. Include definitions, examples, and visual aids. Support search/filter functionality and integration with lesson content.

tasks.title: Create VisualInfographic component for complex concepts
tasks.description: Design a visual infographic component that breaks down complex business concepts into digestible visual elements. Include diagrams, flowcharts, and icons with simple explanations for ELL students.

tasks.title: Create BusinessConcepts data with Mandarin/English bilingual definitions
tasks.description: Build a comprehensive data structure containing business concepts with simplified Chinese translations, Mandarin pronunciations (pinyin), English definitions at 8th grade level, and cultural context for Chinese students. Include visual aids and real-world applications relevant to both Canadian and Chinese business practices.

tasks.title: Create Mandarin-English bilingual interface components
tasks.description: Build bilingual interface components that seamlessly switch between English and simplified Chinese. Include toggle buttons, consistent typography for both languages, and proper text direction handling. Ensure all business terms display in both languages with pinyin pronunciation guides.

tasks.title: Phase 5.1: Create LessonProgressProvider Context
tasks.description: Create React context and provider for managing lesson progress state across the application. This provider will track completion status for each lesson phase (Hook, Introduction, Guided Practice, Independent Practice, Assessment, Closing) and sync with localStorage for persistence. Include methods for updating progress, calculating completion percentages, and providing progress data to child components.

tasks.title: Phase 5.2: Refactor UnitSidebar for MCP Lesson Integration
tasks.description: Completely refactor the existing unit-sidebar.tsx component to integrate with MCP curriculum database. Replace hardcoded sections with dynamic lesson fetching using mcp__curriculum-mcp__get_lessons. Update component interface to support lesson phases navigation (/units/unit01/lesson-01/hook, /lesson-01/introduction, etc.). Implement expandable lesson items showing all 6 phases per lesson with individual progress tracking and phase-specific routing.

tasks.title: Phase 5.4: Create LessonPhaseContent Component
tasks.description: Build a generic LessonPhaseContent component that renders appropriate content based on lesson phase data from MCP database. Component should handle different phase types (Hook, Introduction, Guided Practice, etc.) and dynamically load associated UI components based on app connections. Include navigation controls for moving between phases, progress tracking integration, and support for developer notes display in teacher mode.

tasks.title: Phase 5.5: Add Progress Persistence and Sync
tasks.description: Implement robust progress tracking with localStorage persistence and optional cloud sync preparation. Create utilities for saving/loading progress data, handling progress validation, and providing fallback mechanisms. Include methods for bulk progress operations, progress reset functionality, and data migration helpers for future backend integration. Ensure progress data structure supports both individual lesson phases and overall unit completion tracking.
